author: sky.cactus
content: Do either EL or CL clients need to have *outgoing* access on any port other than 9000 (CL) and 30303 (EL)?  I know that for inbound those are the only ports needing to be opened for communicating with the network, but it isn't clear to me whether the clients use other ports for any outgoing traffic?

author: barnabasbusa
content: usually processes will get a randomized source port, so ideally you want to allow all ports outgoing.

author: sky.cactus
content: When you say "usually processes", what do you mean by that?  Do you mean that the clients will tell the OS they want to connect to `<ip>:9000` and the OS will pick a random port to leave on, and if that port is blocked by the firewall the client will fail to open a connection?

author: potuz
content: You definitely don't want this at all
